item.title: What is wrong with this code?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

Here:

case 375: if(!playerHasItemAmount(991, 1)) { sendMessage("It appears that you will need a key to open this chest."); } else { sendMessage("You open the chest..."); deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1); addItem(Item.randomBarrowsitem(), 1); } break;

That will work 100%

Read full topic
item.source: What is wrong with this code?

item.title: What is wrong with this code?
item.dc:creator: @Marc8333 Marc8333
item.description:
@Marc8333 wrote:

[quote=“The Unholy, post:4, topic:339112”]Are you sure that’s the chest ID? Cause the BARROWS chest is 10284.

Add both of these methods, make sure the object ID, (case number) is correct.

case 375: sendMessage("It appears that you will need a key to open this chest."); } break; 

[code=java]case 375:
            if(!playerHasItemAmount(991, 1);
                    sendMessage("You open the chest...");
                    deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1);
                    addItem(Item.randomBarrowsitem(), 1);
                    frame99(0); //Wth??
            }
            break;[/code][/quote]I'm pretty sure they match.  And I don't want to use the barrows chest at the moment.

It’s really strange it doesn’t work though… It’s based off another case in my client.java

Read full topic

item.title: What is wrong with this code?

@relmitos wrote:

[quote=“The Unholy, post:4, topic:339112”]Are you sure that’s the chest ID? Cause the BARROWS chest is 10284.

case 375: sendMessage("It appears that you will need a key to open this chest."); } break; 

[code=java]case 375:
            if(!playerHasItemAmount(991, 1);
                    sendMessage("You open the chest...");
                    deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1);
                    addItem(Item.randomBarrowsitem(), 1);
                    frame99(0); //Wth??
            }
            break;[/code][/quote]

What’s the extra bracket supposed to do?

Your code will give nothing but errors…

item.title: What is wrong with this code?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

You had one bracket to many.
Also, work on your conventions while it’s not too late. Don’t make it bad habbit…

	case 375:
		if(!playerHasItemAmount(991, 1))
			sendMessage("It appears that you will need a key to open this chest.");
		else {
			sendMessage("You open the chest...");
			deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1);
			addItem(Item.randomBarrowsitem(), 1);
			frame99(0); //What's up with the frame?
		}
		break;

Read full topic
item.source: What is wrong with this code?

item.title: What is wrong with this code?
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

case 375: if((playerHasItemAmount(991, 1)==false)) { { sendMessage("It appears that you will need a key to open this chest."); } } else if((playerHasItemAmount(991, 1)==true)){ sendMessage("You open the chest..."); deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1); addItem(Item.randomBarrowsitem(), 1); frame99(0); } break;

I’m adding a barrows chest and when I open it with the required item nothing happens. I get no compiling errors either. Anybody see anything wrong?

Read full topic
